result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:46 PM Defendant Thomas P Olson not in court.  Attorney Ashley Castro in court for Thomas P Olson.  Prosecuting attorney Kelsey L. Blumenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Defense is not sure why the deft is not here.
BTC: No appearance, Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited. - stay 24 hrs.

2:06 PM Defendant Thomas P Olson in court.  Attorney Alex Hahn for Ashley Castro in court for Thomas P Olson.  Attorney Kelly Larsen in court for State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
State has extended an offer.
Defense is requesting a status date in about 30-45 days.
BTC: Matter adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Thomas P Olson
Current: 30 W. Sedgemedow, Elkhorn, WI 53121 United States  (Effective: 07-21-2022)
Prior: 7409 7th Ave, Kenosha, WI 53143 United States

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victims K.R and S.R (person, property, residence or family). No contact with 1638park ave. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

9:10 AM Prosecuting attorney Matthew W Kline in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas P Olson in court, in custody.  Attorney Ashley Castro in court for Thomas P Olson. Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley. 
Deft missed court on 7-11-22, 7-13-22 and 7-15-22.
BTC: VACATE WARRANT.
State is requesting a high cash bond.
Defense indicates the deft got his court dates confused.
Defense would ask that bond be reinstated and not increased.
BTC: Reinstate the bond, increase the bond to $900 cash, all conditions remain, matter adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE
Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victims K.R and S.R (person, property, residence or family). No contact with 1638park ave. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.
